about_the_game:
Look Back is a side-scrolling platformer where you enter the mind of a man, facing yourself in a journey of self-discovery.



Kent is an ordinary person, living a mediocre and monotonous life, full of frustrations and regrets. Trapped in the automatic routine of everyday life, he feels broken and empty, as if he's merely surviving rather than truly living.



Deep down, Kent knows it's time to ask for help. However, his greatest challenge is to face himself and explore the depths of his own mind to understand where and why he got lost. In Look Back, you will follow Kent's introspective journey as he struggles to find meaning and hope in his life.



Will he be able to break the invisible chains that imprison him and finally get to know himself better? Or will he remain trapped in his own labyrinth of doubts and despa

Features:
Deep Narrative: Explore Kent's life and thoughts, delving into his complex psyche.
Exploration and Challenges: Navigate side-scrolling levels, each representing different aspects of Kent's mind and life. Face obstacles that symbolize his frustrations and fears.
Varied Environments: From dark, claustrophobic settings representing daily monotony to more abstract worlds illustrating internal conflicts and the quest for help.
Narrative Progression: As you advance, uncover fragments of Kent's story through dialogues, texts, and visual memories, deepening your emotional journey.
Prepare for an introspective and emotional experience in Look Back. Face your own demons alongside Kent and discover if there's a light at the end of the tunnel.
